ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: At what point in the study was this information collected?
Notes: 0 = Baseline; 1 = 8 Weeks; 2 = 16-18 Weeks; 3 = 36 weeks

ElementDescription: I work...
Notes: 0 = Full-time; 1 = Part-time; 2 = Other

ElementDescription: I am in school...
Notes: 1 = Full-time; 1 = Part-time; 2 = Other

ElementDescription: Number of items scored 2 or 3
Total score
Notes: The scale can be scored by looking at the total score or by creating a mean score for the total score/number items for each domain, omitting those rated not applicable. For clinical purposes, when defining impairment for DSM-IV, clinicians can consider that any domain with at least two items scored 2, one item scored 3 or a mean score >1.5 is impaired.

ElementDescription: Mean score
Notes: Mean of the number of items scored 2 or 3
